problem_text: Find FH if \triangle ABC \sim \triangle DEF, BG is an altitude of \triangle ABC, EH is an altitude of \triangle DEF, BG = 3, BF = 4, FC = 2, and CE = 1.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠CBG, FI, CI, F on BE, ∠GIF, H on DF, ∠FHE, EH ⊥ FH, ∠ACB, ∠FIC, BF, I on FH, CG, 1 = CE, BC, ∠ACF, I on AC, BG ⊥ CG, EH, BG ⊥ GI, △ABC ~ △DEF, ∠DFE, C on EF, ∠HEB, EH ⊥ HI, CF, G on AC, 3 = BG, GI, FH, F on BC, 4 = BF, ∠EFD, ∠CFD, BG, I on DF, ∠BCA, ∠EFI, 2 = CF, EF, ∠IFB

Step 2:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : EH ⊥ FH
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠FHE

Step 3:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠FIC, ∠GIF
Conclusions: pi = ∠FIC + ∠GIF

Step 4:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : I on FH, ∠FHE
Conclusions: ∠FHE = ∠IHE

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : I on AC, ∠ACF
Conclusions: ∠ACF = ∠ICF

Step 6:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : BG ⊥ CG
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠BGC

Step 7:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : BG ⊥ GI
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠BGI

Step 8:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △ABC ~ △DEF
Conclusions: ∠ACB = ∠EFD, ∠BCA = ∠DFE, sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = BC / EF

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠DFE, H on DF
Conclusions: ∠DFE = ∠HFE

Step 10:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : C on EF
Conclusions: EF = CE + CF

Step 11:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠HEB, F on BE
Conclusions: ∠HEB = ∠HEF

Step 12:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : EH ⊥ HI
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠IHE

Step 13:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : CI, CF, FI
Conclusions: △CFI

Step 14:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on AC, ∠ACB
Conclusions: ∠ACB = ∠GCB

Step 15:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : F on BC
Conclusions: BC = BF + CF

Step 16:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on BC, ∠CBG
Conclusions: ∠CBG = ∠FBG

Step 17:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on BC, ∠ACB
Conclusions: ∠ACB = ∠ACF

Step 18:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on EF, ∠EFD
Conclusions: ∠CFD = ∠EFD

Step 19:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : H on DF, ∠EFD
Conclusions: ∠EFD = ∠EFH

Step 20:
Theorem: Definition of Quadrilateral
Premises : GI, BF, BG, FI
Conclusions: Quadrilateral(B, F, I, G)

Step 21:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : CG, BC, BG
Conclusions: △BCG

Step 22:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : I on DF, ∠EFD
Conclusions: ∠EFD = ∠EFI

Step 23:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : I on DF, ∠CFD
Conclusions: ∠CFD = ∠CFI

Step 24:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠DFE, I on DF
Conclusions: ∠DFE = ∠IFE

Step 25:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BCA, G on AC
Conclusions: ∠BCA = ∠BCG

Step 26:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 2 = CF, 4 = BF
Conclusions: 6 = BF + CF

Step 27:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 1 = CE, 2 = CF
Conclusions: 3 = CE + CF

Step 28:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : FH, EF, EH
Conclusions: △EFH

Step 29:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠EFI, ∠IFB
Conclusions: pi = ∠EFI + ∠IFB

Step 30:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠IHE, ∠FHE = ∠IHE, pi / 2 = ∠BGC
Conclusions: ∠BGC = ∠FHE

Step 31:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(C, F, I)
Premises : △CFI
Conclusions: pi = ∠CFI + ∠FIC + ∠ICF

Step 32:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ACB = ∠GCB, ∠ACB = ∠EFD
Conclusions: ∠EFD = ∠GCB

Step 33:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ACB = ∠EFD, ∠ACB = ∠ACF
Conclusions: ∠ACF = ∠EFD

Step 34:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Quadrilateral(G, I, F, B)
Premises : Quadrilateral(B, F, I, G)
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠BGI + ∠FBG + ∠GIF + ∠IFB

Step 35:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(G, C, B)
Premises : △BCG
Conclusions: pi = ∠BGC + ∠CBG + ∠GCB

Step 36:
Theorem: Pythagorean Theorem
Premises : BG ⊥ CG, △BCG
Conclusions: CG = SqrtOf(BC ** 2 - BG ** 2)

Step 37:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CFD = ∠EFD, ∠EFD = ∠EFI
Conclusions: ∠CFD = ∠EFI

Step 38:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DFE = ∠HFE, ∠DFE = ∠IFE
Conclusions: ∠HFE = ∠IFE

Step 39:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BCA = ∠BCG, ∠BCA = ∠DFE
Conclusions: ∠BCG = ∠DFE

Step 40:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : BC = BF + CF, 6 = BF + CF
Conclusions: 6 = BC

Step 41:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : EF = CE + CF, 3 = CE + CF
Conclusions: 3 = EF

Step 42:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(E, F, H)
Premises : △EFH
Conclusions: pi = ∠EFH + ∠FHE + ∠HEF

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EFD = ∠GCB, ∠EFD = ∠EFI
Conclusions: ∠EFI = ∠GCB

Step 44:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EFD = ∠EFH, ∠ACF = ∠EFD, ∠ACF = ∠ICF
Conclusions: ∠EFH = ∠ICF

Step 45:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CFD = ∠CFI, ∠CFD = ∠EFI
Conclusions: ∠CFI = ∠EFI

Step 46:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DFE = ∠IFE, ∠HFE = ∠IFE, ∠BCG = ∠DFE
Conclusions: ∠BCG = ∠HFE

Step 47:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 6 = BC, 3 = BG
Conclusions: 5.2 = SqrtOf(BC ** 2 - BG ** 2)

Step 48:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 6 = BC, 3 = EF
Conclusions: 2 = BC / EF

Step 49:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : pi = ∠BGC + ∠CBG + ∠GCB, pi = ∠EFI + ∠IFB, ∠EFI = ∠GCB, 2 * pi = ∠BGI + ∠FBG + ∠GIF + ∠IFB, pi = ∠FIC + ∠GIF, ∠CBG = ∠FBG, pi / 2 = ∠BGI, pi / 2 = ∠BGC
Conclusions: ∠FBG = 0.5 * ∠FIC

Step 50:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EFD = ∠EFH, ∠CFI = ∠EFI, ∠EFD = ∠EFI
Conclusions: ∠CFI = ∠EFH

Step 51:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : CG = SqrtOf(BC ** 2 - BG ** 2), 5.2 = SqrtOf(BC ** 2 - BG ** 2)
Conclusions: 5.2 = CG

Step 52:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = BC / EF, 2 = BC / EF
Conclusions: 2 = sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f

Step 53:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠FHE, ∠HEB = ∠HEF, pi = ∠EFH + ∠FHE + ∠HEF, pi = ∠CFI + ∠FIC + ∠ICF, ∠CFI = ∠EFH, ∠EFH = ∠ICF
Conclusions: ∠HEB = 0.5 * ∠FIC

Step 54:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 5.2 = CG, 3 = BG
Conclusions: 1.73 = CG / BG

Step 55:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 6 = BC, 5.2 = CG
Conclusions: 1.15 = BC / CG

Step 56:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 6 = BC, 5.2 = CG, 3 = BG
Conclusions: 7.1 = (BC + BG + CG) / 2

Step 57:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠FBG = 0.5 * ∠FIC, ∠HEB = 0.5 * ∠FIC, ∠HEB = ∠HEF
Conclusions: ∠FBG = ∠HEF

Step 58:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠FBG = ∠HEF, ∠CBG = ∠FBG
Conclusions: ∠CBG = ∠HEF

Step 59:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠CBG = ∠HEF, ∠BCG = ∠HFE, ∠BGC = ∠FHE
Conclusions: △BCG ~ △EFH

Step 60:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △BCG ~ △EFH
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h = CG / FH, ∠CBG = ∠HEF, sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h = BC / EF, ∠BCG = ∠HFE

Step 61:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h = BC / EF, sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = BC / EF
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h

Step 62:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h = CG / FH, sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = sim_ratio_triangle_b_c_g_triangle_e_f_h
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = CG / FH

Step 63:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 = sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f, sim_ratio_triangle_a_b_c_triangle_d_e_f = CG / FH
Conclusions: 2 = CG / FH

Step 64:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 7.1 = (BC + BG + CG) / 2, 1.73 = CG / BG, 1.15 = BC / CG, 2 = CG / FH
Conclusions: 2.6 = FH
logic_fomrs_refined: Similar(Triangle(A, B, C), Triangle(D, E, F))
